alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; Dripping Springs; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Thunderstorm winds and potentially additional thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 600 PM MST... At 456 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm winds along a line extending from near Black Canyon City to 9 miles northeast of New River to 7 miles south of Horseshoe Reservoir to near Round Valley to near Four Peaks to 7 miles north of Superior to 8 miles south of Top-Of-The-World. Movement was south at 10 mph. Blowing dust possible. Additional storm redevelopment possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, Apache Junction, Fountain Hills, Superior, Gold Canyon, Sugarloaf Mountain, New River, Ballantine Trailhead, Round Valley, Cave Creek, Carefree, Gold Camp, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Canyon Lake, Superstition Mountains, Goldfield Ranch and Desert Mountain. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 224 and 241. US Highway 60 between mile markers 199 and 234. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 190 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
